instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no trackpad {bad <CHIP>U5805</CHIP>}
threads.message:
The trackpad sometimes works just a little bit on some parts but its mostly dead.
Tried other cables and trackpads with same resoults.
The connector gets very hot when the computer starts.
Everything else seems to work.
The board is clean and have no signs of liquid

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no trackpad {bad <CHIP>U5805</CHIP>}
[SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no trackpad {bad <CHIP>U5805</CHIP>}
threads.message: <CHIP>U5805</CHIP> Pin 2 is 4,9 volt other pins 0 volt

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no trackpad {bad <CHIP>U5805</CHIP>}
threads.message: Something is getting hot? I'd find out what it is, I doubt it is the connector. 18V will only be present if TP is connected.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no trackpad {bad <CHIP>U5805</CHIP>}
threads.message: Check <CHIP>U5805</CHIP>. Sounds like it might be shorting to ground, and is heating up directly behind the trackpad connector. Also explains the no-trackpad.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no trackpad {bad <CHIP>U5805</CHIP>}
threads.message: yes, without tp connected <CHIP>U5805</CHIP> doesnt get hot but when tp is connected it goes hot very fast

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no trackpad {bad <CHIP>U5805</CHIP>}
[SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no trackpad {bad <CHIP>U5805</CHIP>}
threads.message: replaced <CHIP>U5805</CHIP> and now it seems to work
